intro: Heppiella cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is characterized by its leafy, thalloid structure and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead having a flat, ribbon-like body called a thallus. Heppiella cubensis reproduces via spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporophytes. This species is of particular interest in botanical studies due to its unique adaptations and ecological significance in tropical ecosystems.
